intro: Hibbertia rhadinopoda, commonly known as the red-stemmed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and bright yellow flowers with prominent, elongated petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Hibbertia rhadinopoda is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds.
